review: This is a really cool device! Well lets see. I bought this to think about cancelling my cable provider all together, but i cant. You still need your cable/satellite provider to get an activation code to watch different programs such as the History Channel, CBS, and much more. I have sent this this information already and there is still some work that needs to be done with it, but its still a good device. It is NOT good to be connected to your Xbox One. When connected to the Xbox One, it does slow down 'a lot' and gets very annoying.  When the HDMI cable is connected from the Amazon Fire TV directly to the TV itself, then it works very good! working at a high speed and resolving my frustration i had when i had it connected through my Xbox One. Watching a small set of movies does require to rent or buy IF its not part of Amazon Prime. TV shows does require a activation code to your cable/satellite, and which still requires you to keep your cable/satellite provider for the basic channels. Using this can lower your bill quite a bit to only keep the basic channels to convert it to the Amazon Fire TV where you can also watch mostly free movies, series such as Star Trek Enterprise and others.Overall its a great buy to watch movies, play games, listen to music, look at photos, and still needs some work on TV programs that still require a cable provider. It MUST be connected to the TV directly to work at its full potential at good speeds, and NOT to be connected through the Xbox One. It still needs some work for the TV programs that require a activate code for every program you want on your Amazon Fire TV, but its still a great buy and its a must to get! the voice works very well i must add. i just say what movie or show i want to watch, and it comes up. I dont have to say 'search for' or 'find'...just say your show or movie and there it is!
author: Ray A.
